args: So this is Valzgald... It's huge!\nAnd talk about bustling!
Oh, um, yes. Valzgald is one of the North's\nmost active trade centers.
It's said they grew to this scale by\nbecoming a melting pot for all sorts\nof different cultures and peoples.
Ooh, then we should be able to learn all\nSORTS of things here!
Let's get to it, yeah? C'mon, you two.
Huh. This backstreet feels awfully\ndifferent from the main boulevard.
Th-this is the, um...less affluent part of\ntown. A slum, really, and i-it's not very\nsafe here, so we should really...
A slum? The city's this established,\nbut they still have a poverty problem?
Yes. It's true that Valzgald developed by\ntaking in aspects of other cultures that\nboosted their productivity, but, er...
Quickly jumping to new ways of doing\nthings can mean that old traditions sort\nof...fall by the wayside.
And as efficiency increases, there's less\nneed for labor, s-so lots of people have\nfound themselves out of work.
Plus, not everyone is capable of keeping\nup when things change so fast.
Gotcha... I guess being eager to adopt\nother cultures has its challenges.\n...Hm?
Oh, I was just looking at that stall.
Wooow, these are all so awesome!\nDid you make all these here, mister?
I got no time for window shoppers.\nMove along.
Huh? I wasn't trying to be a nuisance...
Yeah right, sylvan. As if you steel haters\ncan see the value in quality metalcraft.
Hey now! That's not fair of you to say.
I meant it when I said these accessories\nlook amazing, so please don't be like that!
Oh, be still my heart. I'm blushing already.\nNow, why don't you turn your little\ncottontail around and go home, bunny?
Okay, THAT does it. You wanna see me\nget serious? 'Cause I'm about to get\nserious over here!
Now stop being a big jerk and teach me\nhow to make these things!
Wh-what are you on about?\nYou're tourists, ain't ya?
I can stay here awhile! RIGHT, Noelle?
Huh?! Er, uhhh, y-yes! Our itinerary has\nus staying here for, um... For five days?
See? Plenty of time! I'm not a tourist, by\nthe wayâ€”I'm here to study other cultures.
And I'll have you know I'm a very quick\nlearner, so teach me some rokkan tech!
Fine. I'll be REAL curious to see if a\nwimpy little sylvan girl's up to the task.
*gasp* *pant* I... I didn't think I'd be\nmining my own ore!
Rrgh! I'm FINE, thankyouverymuch! I'll dig\nclear through the mountain if I have to!
See, you gotta work it into shape while it's\nstill red-hot. It'll send up sparks, but you're\njust gonna have to tough it out!
*groooan* I've got burns all over,\nand my whole body is sore...
Hey. I told you to be here before sunrise.\nA craftsman's day starts early.
I know that! I swear, I'm gonna make\nan accessory so nice, you'll BEG me to\nlet you sell it at your stall!
Hah. Cute. Now stop giving me lip\nand march to the workshop.
It's not awful. Still rough around the\nedges, but it's better than I expected.
Today's your last day, yeah? You took it\nright down to the wire, but...we'll call it\na passing grade.
Hmph. May as well commemorate the\noccasion. You made this thing, so take\nit with you.
Sure. Call it a memento. It's...the last\npiece that'll come out of this shop anyhow.
Exactly what it sounds like.\nI'm going out of business.
You're giving up on your stall?!
Yeah. Writing's been on the wall for a\nwhile now. I figured you'd give up and run\nafter a day, tops, so I didn't mention it.
But steelwork is a traditional rokkan craft,\nisn't it? Why give it up?
It is, and I'm damn proud of it. I'm not\ngiving it up, exactly. It'll just be taking\na different shape.
This is one of your accessories, yeah?
...Wait, no. It's nice enough, but it doesn't\nhave the same flavor as one of yours.
No surprises there. Wasn't made by hand.
It wasn't? Then how was it made?
With another rokkan city's tech. ï¼‚Metal\ncasting,ï¼‚ they call it. It's the latest trend\nto catch on around these parts.
Quickly jumping to new ways of doing\nthings can mean that old traditions sort\nof...fall by the wayside.
So, people are just going to switch to this\nnew way of steelworking?
Casting's better for mass production. More\nproduct means more sales means a richer\ncity. So they told me to ditch the old stuff.
But...don't you feel any attachment to\nhand-crafting your pieces?
'Course I do. But I gotta eat. I gotta live.\nSo I'm closing up the workshop and\nstarting work at the big factory downtown.
It's a good place, with good people. Just...\nI'm sad to see the old hand-crafting ways\ndisappear like so much smoke.
That's where you're wrong. They won't.
People may be all for casting right now.\nIt's cheap and you can put out a lot of\nproductâ€”and that's all fine and dandy.
But someday they'll realize that handmade\npieces have a charm you just can't get\nanywhere else!
Heck, even I could tell that one apart from\nyour work at a glance. I know yours are\nway nicer!
People will come back around to wanting\nyour work again, and in droves. So don't\nyou worry about your tradition ending!
Heh heh... Just do me a favor and don't\never forget the craft you worked so hard\nto hone. I promise I won't forget it, either.
Keep teaching your techniques to more\npeople like you taught them to me. That\nway, you'll know your tradition will live on.
Gah hah hah ha! Yeah... I'd take a decent\nhand-made piece over a mass-produced\npiece of junk any day, too!
Soon as the knuckleheads in this town\nwise up to that, I'll be right back to my\nworkshop.
Till then... You got a deal. I won't forget.\nAnd that's a promise.
I'll hold you to it!\nAnd I promise you the same.
